title: Authors and Citation

code: @Manual{,   title = {inferCSN: Inferring cell-specific gene regulatory network},   author = {{MengXu}},   year = {2023},   note = {R package version 0.1.1},   url = {https://mengxu98.github.io/inferCSN/}, }

title: Inferring cell-specific gene regulatory network
code: # install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("wiscstatman/EBSeq") devtools::install_github("hazimehh/L0Learn") devtools::install_github("mengxu98/inferCSN")

title: Inferring cell-specific gene regulatory network
code: git clone https://github.com/mengxu98/inferCSN.git cd inferCSN sudo R CMD INSTALL . # Some packages may prompt not available, please install.

title: auc.calculate — auc.calculate
code: data("exampleDataMatrix") data("exampleDataGroundTruth") weightList <- inferCSN(exampleDataMatrix, cores = 1, verbose = TRUE) #> Data processing...... #> Using L0 penalty regression...... #> Using  L0 fit...... auc <- auc.calculate(weightList, exampleDataGroundTruth)

title: Extract Solutions — coef.inferCSN
text: object output inferCSN.fit inferCSN.cvfit lambda value lambda extract solution. gamma value gamma extract solution. supportSize number non-zeros solution extracted contain. solutions `supportSize` non-zeros, solutions closest number extracted. ... ignore

title: compute.gene.rank — compute.gene.rank
code: data("exampleDataMatrix") weightList <- inferCSN(exampleDataMatrix) compute.gene.rank(weightList) #>     gene   pageRank is_regulator #> g18  g18 0.06780223         TRUE #> g17  g17 0.06509984         TRUE #> g15  g15 0.05739915         TRUE #> g4    g4 0.05731333         TRUE #> g14  g14 0.05714662         TRUE #> g13  g13 0.05675850         TRUE #> g11  g11 0.05661139         TRUE #> g16  g16 0.05645302         TRUE #> g7    g7 0.05554882         TRUE #> g10  g10 0.05539587         TRUE #> g6    g6 0.05503414         TRUE #> g9    g9 0.05479741         TRUE #> g5    g5 0.05458000         TRUE #> g8    g8 0.05424040         TRUE #> g3    g3 0.05372278         TRUE #> g12  g12 0.05354519         TRUE #> g2    g2 0.04605371         TRUE #> g1    g1 0.04249759         TRUE

title: Perform crossweighting — crossweight
code: crossweight(   grnTab,   expDat,   xdyn,   lag = floor(ncol(expDat)/5),   min = ceiling(ncol(expDat)/50),   max = floor(ncol(expDat)/12),   symmetric_filter = FALSE,   filter_thresh = 0 )

title: Perform crossweighting — crossweight
text: grnTab GRN dataframe, result running reconstructGRN reconstructGRN_GENIE3 expDat genes--cells expression matrix xdyn result running findDynGenes lag lag window run cross-correlation. Cross-correlaiton computed -lag +lag. min minimum weighting window. Edges offsets (absolute offsets symmetric_filter=TRUE) less min negatively weighted. max maximum weighting window. Edges offsets (absolute offsets symmetric_filter=TRUE) greater max weights set 0. symmetric_filter whether employ symmetric weight scheme. true, absolute offset used place offset. filter_thresh crossweighting, edges weights less filter_thresh set 0.

what:
crossweight_params
 estimates min and max values for crossweighting
 for now assumes uniform cell density across pseudotime/only considers early time
 this needs to be refined if it's to be useful... — crossweight_params

title: inferCSN.fit — inferCSN.core
code: inferCSN.core(   X,   y,   crossValidation = crossValidation,   penalty = penalty,   maxSuppSize = maxSuppSize,   nFolds = nFolds,   nGamma = nGamma,   verbose = verbose )

title: inferCSN.fit — inferCSN.core
text: X rows samples columns genes matrix y Target vector crossValidation Cross validation penalty penalty = penalty maxSuppSize maxSuppSize = maxSuppSize nFolds N folds cross validation nGamma nGamma = nGamma verbose Print detailed information

title: Cross Validation — inferCSN.cvfit
text: Computes regularization path performs K-fold cross-validation.

title: Cross Validation — inferCSN.cvfit
code: inferCSN.cvfit(   x,   y,   loss = "SquaredError",   penalty = "L0",   algorithm = "CD",   maxSuppSize = 100,   nLambda = 100,   nGamma = 10,   gammaMax = 10,   gammaMin = 1e-04,   partialSort = TRUE,   maxIters = 200,   rtol = 1e-06,   atol = 1e-09,   activeSet = TRUE,   activeSetNum = 3,   maxSwaps = 100,   scaleDownFactor = 0.8,   screenSize = 1000,   autoLambda = NULL,   lambdaGrid = list(),   nFolds = 10,   seed = 1,   excludeFirstK = 0,   intercept = TRUE,   lows = -Inf,   highs = Inf )

title: Cross Validation — inferCSN.cvfit
text: x data matrix. y response vector. classification, support binary vectors. loss loss function. Currently support choices "SquaredError" (regression), "Logistic" (logistic regression), "SquaredHinge" (smooth SVM). penalty type regularization. can take either one following choices: "L0", "L0L2", "L0L1". algorithm type algorithm used minimize objective function. Currently "CD" "CDPSI" supported. "CD" variant cyclic coordinate descent runs fast. "CDPSI" performs local combinatorial search top CD typically achieves higher quality solutions (expense increased running time). maxSuppSize maximum support size terminate regularization path. recommend setting small fraction min(n,p) (e.g. 0.05 * min(n,p)) L0 regularization typically selects small portion non-zeros. nLambda number Lambda values select (recall Lambda regularization parameter corresponding L0 norm). value ignored 'lambdaGrid' supplied. nGamma number Gamma values select (recall Gamma regularization parameter corresponding L1 L2, depending chosen penalty). value ignored 'lambdaGrid' supplied set length(lambdaGrid) gammaMax maximum value Gamma using L0L2 penalty. L0L1 penalty automatically selected. gammaMin minimum value Gamma using L0L2 penalty. L0L1 penalty, minimum value gamma grid set gammaMin * gammaMax. Note strictly positive quantity. partialSort TRUE partial sorting used sorting coordinates greedy cycling (see paper details). Otherwise, full sorting used. maxIters maximum number iterations (full cycles) CD per grid point. rtol relative tolerance decides terminate optimization (based relative change objective iterations). atol absolute tolerance decides terminate optimization (based absolute L2 norm residuals). activeSet TRUE, performs active set updates. activeSetNum number consecutive times support appear declaring support stabilization. maxSwaps maximum number swaps used CDPSI grid point. scaleDownFactor parameter decides close selected Lambda values . choice strictly 0 1 (.e., 0 1 allowed). Larger values lead closer lambdas typically smaller gaps support sizes. details, see paper - Section 5 Adaptive Selection Tuning Parameters). screenSize number coordinates cycle performing initial correlation screening. autoLambda Ignored parameter. Kept backwards compatibility. lambdaGrid grid Lambda values use computing regularization path. default empty list ignored. specified, LambdaGrid list length 'nGamma', ith element (corresponding ith gamma) decreasing sequence lambda values used algorithm fitting ith value gamma (see vignette details). nFolds number folds cross-validation. seed seed used randomly shuffling data cross-validation. excludeFirstK parameter takes non-negative integers. first excludeFirstK features x excluded variable selection, .e., first excludeFirstK variables included L0-norm penalty (still included L1 L2 norm penalties.). intercept FALSE, intercept term included model. lows Lower bounds coefficients. Either scalar coefficients bound vector size p (number columns X) lows[] lower bound coefficient . highs Upper bounds coefficients. Either scalar coefficients bound vector size p (number columns X) highs[] upper bound coefficient .

title: Cross Validation — inferCSN.cvfit
text: S3 object type "inferCSNCV" describing regularization path. object following members. cvMeans list, ith element sequence cross-validation errors corresponding ith gamma value, .e., sequence cvMeans[[]] corresponds fit$gamma[] cvSDs list, ith element sequence standard deviations cross-validation errors: cvSDs[[]] corresponds cvMeans[[]]. fit fitted model type "inferCSN", .e., object returned inferCSN.fit.

title: Fit an L0-regularized model — inferCSN.fit
text: Computes regularization path specified loss function penalty function (can combination L0, L1, L2 norms).

title: Fit an L0-regularized model — inferCSN.fit
code: inferCSN.fit(   x,   y,   loss = "SquaredError",   penalty = "L0",   algorithm = "CD",   maxSuppSize = 100,   nLambda = 100,   nGamma = 10,   gammaMax = 10,   gammaMin = 1e-04,   partialSort = TRUE,   maxIters = 200,   rtol = 1e-06,   atol = 1e-09,   activeSet = TRUE,   activeSetNum = 3,   maxSwaps = 100,   scaleDownFactor = 0.8,   screenSize = 1000,   autoLambda = NULL,   lambdaGrid = list(),   excludeFirstK = 0,   intercept = TRUE,   lows = -Inf,   highs = Inf )

title: Fit an L0-regularized model — inferCSN.fit
text: x data matrix. y response vector. classification, support binary vectors. loss loss function. Currently support choices "SquaredError" (regression), "Logistic" (logistic regression), "SquaredHinge" (smooth SVM). penalty type regularization. can take either one following choices: "L0", "L0L2", "L0L1". algorithm type algorithm used minimize objective function. Currently "CD" "CDPSI" supported. "CD" variant cyclic coordinate descent runs fast. "CDPSI" performs local combinatorial search top CD typically achieves higher quality solutions (expense increased running time). maxSuppSize maximum support size terminate regularization path. recommend setting small fraction min(n,p) (e.g. 0.05 * min(n,p)) L0 regularization typically selects small portion non-zeros. nLambda number Lambda values select (recall Lambda regularization parameter corresponding L0 norm). value ignored 'lambdaGrid' supplied. nGamma number Gamma values select (recall Gamma regularization parameter corresponding L1 L2, depending chosen penalty). value ignored 'lambdaGrid' supplied set length(lambdaGrid) gammaMax maximum value Gamma using L0L2 penalty. L0L1 penalty automatically selected. gammaMin minimum value Gamma using L0L2 penalty. L0L1 penalty, minimum value gamma grid set gammaMin * gammaMax. Note strictly positive quantity. partialSort TRUE partial sorting used sorting coordinates greedy cycling (see paper details). Otherwise, full sorting used. maxIters maximum number iterations (full cycles) CD per grid point. rtol relative tolerance decides terminate optimization (based relative change objective iterations). atol absolute tolerance decides terminate optimization (based absolute L2 norm residuals). activeSet TRUE, performs active set updates. activeSetNum number consecutive times support appear declaring support stabilization. maxSwaps maximum number swaps used CDPSI grid point. scaleDownFactor parameter decides close selected Lambda values . choice strictly 0 1 (.e., 0 1 allowed). Larger values lead closer lambdas typically smaller gaps support sizes. details, see paper - Section 5 Adaptive Selection Tuning Parameters). screenSize number coordinates cycle performing initial correlation screening. autoLambda Ignored parameter. Kept backwards compatibility. lambdaGrid grid Lambda values use computing regularization path. default empty list ignored. specified, LambdaGrid list length 'nGamma', ith element (corresponding ith gamma) decreasing sequence lambda values used algorithm fitting ith value gamma (see vignette details). excludeFirstK parameter takes non-negative integers. first excludeFirstK features x excluded variable selection, .e., first excludeFirstK variables included L0-norm penalty (still included L1 L2 norm penalties.). intercept FALSE, intercept term included model. lows Lower bounds coefficients. Either scalar coefficients bound vector size p (number columns X) lows[] lower bound coefficient . highs Upper bounds coefficients. Either scalar coefficients bound vector size p (number columns X) highs[] upper bound coefficient .

title: Fit an L0-regularized model — inferCSN.fit
text: S3 object type "inferCSN" describing regularization path. object following members. a0 a0 list intercept sequences. ith element list (.e., a0[[]]) sequence intercepts corresponding ith gamma value (.e., gamma[]). beta list coefficient matrices. ith element list p x length(lambda) matrix corresponds ith gamma value. jth column coefficient matrix vector coefficients jth lambda value. lambda list lambda sequences used fitting model. ith element lambda (.e., lambda[[]]) sequence Lambda values corresponding ith gamma value. gamma sequence gamma values used fitting model. suppSize list support size sequences. ith element list sequence support sizes (.e., number non-zero coefficients) corresponding ith gamma value. converged list sequences checking whether algorithm converged every grid point. ith element list sequence corresponding ith value gamma, jth element sequence indicates whether algorithm converged jth value lambda.

title: inferCSN — inferCSN
text: method inferring cell-type-specific gene regulatory network single-cell transcriptome data.

title: inferCSN — inferCSN
code: inferCSN(   data = NULL,   normalize = FALSE,   penalty = NULL,   crossValidation = FALSE,   nFolds = 10,   regulators = NULL,   targets = NULL,   maxSuppSize = NULL,   nGamma = 5,   verbose = FALSE,   cores = 1 )

title: inferCSN — inferCSN
text: data [Default = NULL] object normalize [Default = FALSE] Data normalize penalty [Default = NULL] crossValidation [Default = FALSE] Check whether cross validation used nFolds [Default = 10] N folds cross validation regulators [Default = NULL] Regulator genes targets [Default = NULL] Target genes maxSuppSize [Default = NULL] number non-zore coef nGamma [Default = 5] nGamma verbose [Default = FALSE] Print detailed information cores [Default = 1] CPU cores
